Instruction: Adjust the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Fry the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove the bacon from the skillet, saving 4 tablespoons of the bacon fat, and place the cooked bacon on paper towels to drain.

Cook bacon in a skillet until crisp; remove bacon and set aside. Saute onions in the remaining bacon fat until browned, then season and add milk and cream to the skillet. Sprinkle flour over onions, stir to blend, and cook until thickened. Remove from heat, stir in bacon, and let cool for 10 minutes.

Whisk the eggs in a bowl until light and frothy. Gradually incorporate spoonfuls of the onion mixture into the eggs, stirring continuously until well combined. Transfer the entire mixture to the pie shell, spreading it evenly. Sprinkle nutmeg on top before baking.
Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is lightly browned, approximately 20 minutes. Take it out of the oven and let it cool for 5 minutes before serving.
